page.title: 09ROADS AND LANES.
page.content: With a disused railway line in the south-east corner of the block the only form of wheeled{COMMUNICATION} from place to place is by road and lane.The Chairman of Avening Parish Council said that fifty years ago most {ROADS}were unsurfaced but covered with a white stone instead, which became muddy during wet weather.However, many unsurfaced lanes used only as footpaths today were used by wheeled{ {TRANSPORT}in the past, when they would have been wider.Greenway Head, Avening was used by pack horses to carry wool from the higher sheep grazing lands around Tetbury to mills in Avening and Nailsworth.Most of the roads and lanes in the block are rather narrow, even the B4014 from Nailsworth to Tetbury is only 6.7 metres wide and yet it takes heavy goods traffic, there being a haulage {INDUSTRY}in Avening.
